alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 05 at 4:27AM PST until January 08 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 12 to 16 feet, with sets to 20 feet. Dangerous rip currents. The highest surf will be on west and northwest facing beaches, such as Morro Bay State Park and Oceano Dunes State Park. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...Until 9 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor coastal flooding risk through Friday. Saturday through Monday during early morning tides at 5-6 AM, advisory level coastal flooding is possible, with the greatest impacts expected Saturday.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
